properties.areaDesc: Cumberland, VA; Amelia, VA; Prince Edward, VA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 6:32AM EST until February 8 at 3:43PM EST by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Virginia...North Carolina...

Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Amelia...Cumberland and
Prince Edward Counties

Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County

Cashie River Near Windsor affecting Bertie County


For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville...Minor flooding is
forecast.For the Chowan Basin...including Lawrenceville...Minor
flooding is forecast.For the Lower Roanoke Basin...including
Windsor...Minor flooding is forecast.

The Flood Warning continues for...
The Appomattox River Above Farmville
* until Saturday afternoon...or until the warning is cancelled.
* At 06:20 AM Friday the stage was 14.4 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 17.0 feet by
after midnight tomorrow. The river will fall below flood stage
tomorrow late morning.
* At 18.0 feet...River Rd downstream of the gage near the railroad
bridge begins to flood.
This river level is comparable to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on
Jul 12 2013.
